name: IVORY ANTLER - The Cult of Ivory Antler shirt
description: Swear the oath! Unisex t-shirt silk screened in two colors at Iron Forge Press. Front emblem by Rainbath Visual, Edition of 100. * Model wears a small.

name: GATES - The Prevailing Wind 12"
description: It's been a cold winter. Initially released by the band's own Astral Ra imprint in a long-sold-out edition of 50 cassettes, Ivory Antler is proud to present Gates' seldom-heard The Prevailing Wind as one of the bands' two inaugural vinyl releases.* A companion piece to Moths Have Eaten the Core, the album was recorded during the same sessions and is meant to serve as a further exploration of similar forms and environments. These recordings have been carefully remastered for 180 gram vinyl by James Plotkin in a physical presentation that features new artwork by photographer A.E. Casky and Gates mastermind Bryan Bray. This edition is strictly limited to 200 hand-numbered copies worldwide. Includes folded poster and digital download card. Also available is the Through the Howling Infinite 2x12" set, a co-release between Ivory Antler Recording & Publishing and Anti-Matter Records. This elegant package unfolds to reveal both The Prevailing Wind & Moths Have Eaten the Core albums on black vinyl, housed with exclusive inserts. Strictly limited to 50 hand-numbered copies worldwide. 2xLP SET IS SOLD OUT 1. Incantation | 10:20 2. A Pale Shadow Can Still Be Seen | 10:02 3. As Though Whispering Through the Leaves |12:49 4. Frost | 7:30 The video for Incantation can be viewed here. Shot & directed by Justin Oakey. * Stand-alone copies of the Moths Have Eaten the Core 12" available from Anti-Matter Records. "Brutal and beautiful all at once. I would hunt this down immediately ... Excellent work from my new favorite Canadian. " - 4/5 - Dead Formats IA15

name: NJIQAHDDA - Serpents in the Sky CS
description:
Very limited quantities remain! The latest full-length from Njiqahdda represent a dramatic turn for the prolific atmospheric black metal entity. Conceived in the coldest corners of Illinois, Serpents in the Sky represents the group’s first foray as one-piece. But don’t be alarmed – the aural magick within is just as dark, dense, chaotic, & beautiful as anything the project has produced before. This pressing also features an exclusive bonus track, Skyadh (Parts I & II) .

Ivory Antler Recording & Publishing is proud to release Serpents in the Sky as a cassette edition of 50 hand-numbered copies worldwide. Lavender shells with metallic gold ink. Includes silk-screened patch. 1. Gaia | 5:52 2. The Veil Of Allaeius | 5:45 3. With Clouds | 7:57 4. She Which Water Holds | 12:03 5. Exclave | 9:29 6. Serpents In The Sky... | 11:59 7. ...And The Men Behind The Sun | 17:28 8. Skyadh (Parts I & II) | 8:36 * *Cassette-only bonus track. IA16

name: ARCTIQUE CIRCLES - Infinity Bouquet Patch
description: Silk-screened patch featuring Arctique Circles' "Infinity Bouquet" logo. White ink on heavy black canvas - extremely limited quantities available!

name: ARCTIQUE CIRCLES - Vesica Pisces 2xCS/2xCD
description:
The long-promised 2xCS set featuring both of Arctique Circles' full length releases - the 2009 EP Golden Gloom (with over 20 minutes of music not available in the free digital version) and the unreleased 2008 album of early material and demos, A Great & Terrible Beauty. Released in a hand numbered edition of 100. Includes silk-screened patch! Digital album also available. CS 1: A Great & Terrible Beauty 1. I Lost My Love to the Storm | 5:34 * 2. Agony in Bloom | 19:47 3. Tied to the Mast | 17:18 4. My Breath Turned to Steam, Hers Turned to Ice | 0:32 5. I Will Use You to Conquer Kingdoms | 4:20 6. Hearts in Antarctica | 13:27 7. How Unfortunate That We Should Drown in These Waves | 7:51 CS 2: Golden Gloom 1. When You Sleep | 7:53 2. The Wolves Gather | 11:24 3. Thrilled to Be Here | 5:44 4. The Wolves Gather (early demo) | 5:30 5. In the Company of Wolves | 22:25

* IA03

name: BLOOD BRIGHT STAR / AMONG THE BONES - Split CD
description: Ivory Antler is proud to present a mesmerizing showcase of two solo post-rock outfits from both sides of the pond - Blood Bright Star, the project of American visual/recording artist Reuben Sawyer, and Among the Bones, fronted by the UK’s Misha Hering. The physical documentation of a union that is both hypnotically heavy and potently psychedelic. Fans of Earth & Grails will not be disappointed. Limited to 300 copies worldwide. Includes silk-screened patch. Blood Bright Star: 1. Intro to Blood Bright Star | 1:51 2. Another Love Will Sharpen the Knife | 4:00 3. Kept | 3:58 4. Ripped From the Grave | 3:14 5. Being Never Ending | 5:11 Among the Bones: 1. Arctic Monolith | 5:00 2. Erebus, Ancient Master | 4:24 3. Black Heart | 4:51 4. Pole Star | 3:56 IA08

name: NJIQAHDDA - The Path of Liberation from Birth and Death 2x12"
description:
We are very proud to announce Njiqahdda's first vinyl release, 2011's Path of Liberation from Birth and Death presented on 2x 200 gram 12" vinyls. New artwork and remastered audio produced exclusively for this unique pressing. Strictly limited to 300 copies (100 Black, 200 Sacrificial Blood). RSD MMXIII Edition - Njiqahhda's 2011 opus Path of Liberation from Birth and Death 2x12" on mixed red & black 180 gram vinyl LPs. Limited to 16 copies each hand-numbered for the occasion. Also includes silk-screened patch. 1. To Return From The Flame 2. Transcendental Knowledge Upon The Battlefield * 3. Attaining The Confidential Supreme Absolute 4. Universal Form Replaced With Despondant Chaos 5. The Opulant Throne 6. Sky And Earth Remembered Only As Blood I) Visions II) Remembrance III) Heads Smashed By Teeth

*

IA07

name: TRILOBITE - Delusions of Grandeur 12"
description:
Instrumental group Trilobite's debut release on 180 gram vinyl. Limited to 300 hand numbered copies in heavyweight case-wrapped jackets with natural matte finish. Artwork by the inimitable Justin Bartlett. RSD MMXIII Edition - 25 hand-numbered test pressings on 180 gram black vinyls, packaged with new artwork by Goatfucker's Jack Mulkern produced exclusively for this edition. Digital album also available. 1. Catalyst | 2:36 2. Delusions of Grandeur | 4:39 3. The Trench | 3:12 4. Australis | 6:10 5. Following Seas | 8:05 *

*

"Delusions of Grandeur' is thus an album that will leave you thinking, and one that is seemingly intent on sending your mind into a realm of curiously dark interests." - 4.5/5 - Heathen Harvest "Just an exciting album all the way through. Once you press play it takes off. With so much to process this album lends itself to multiple listens." - Metal Bandcamp "Accomplished playing all across the board really sets this apart from everything like it. It seems to retain a definite meatiness that I’ve not heard from anyone doing this sort of thing." - Blackened Slugs IA02

name: ARCTIQUE CIRCLES / BARAN - Split 12"

This is Your God | 14:00 "I don’t say the phrase “must have” very often in my reviews, even through perfects scores, but I’d have a hard time not recommending this split to anyone." - Heathen Harvest IA01

name: CIRCLE OF EYES - s/t 12"
description: Circle of Eyes is the ambient doom project from Sutekh Hexen's Kevin Gan Yuen and Necrite's Thrull. This recording also features vocals by James R. of Swamp Witch and Your Enemy. Circle of Eyes was conceived in 2008 for the love of resonance and embracing the realization of decay in the intent to record/release records and perform the occasional live performance. The creative core-duo of Kevin Gan Yuen (Sutekh Hexen, Fermentæ, OGHAM) along with Thrull (Black Fucking Cancer and Necrite) proceed with Circle of Eyes as an on-going project in the practice of unraveling and challenging the conventional notions of the loud, slow and down-tuned metal traditions of the Bay Area's rich sonic tapestry. Joined by vocalist/collaborator James R. (Swamp Witch and Your Enemy) this entity's uncompromising collective vision is to present an exclusive aural documentation of the unquestionable decay of black metal, drone, and experimental music genres. With three mammoth tracks that spread over 37 minutes, this recording is mastered by James Plotkin specifically for the vinyl and digital formats. The artwork and design was executed by Kevin Gan Yuen with help from Stephen Wilson for an 18” x 24” fold-out poster and Icelandic (by way of Sweden) artist and musician Jóhannes Gunnar Þorsteinsson (Ziz) for the insert photography. The jackets are a tip-on style, single sleeve jacket printed from Stoughton Printing Company, black dust sleeves, a three button set that’s housed in a black zip lock bag, and a download card printed on 32 lb. metallic stock to redeem the entire recording which also includes the re-mastered 2009 demo as an an added bonus. With everything included, this is 90:06 of drone madness... test your psyche! Edition run of 325 copies in three different color variations: 160 on black vinyl, 110 on white vinyl, and 55 on orange vinyl. AM01

name: TERENCE HANNUM - The Unholy Bow publication
description:
From Snakefork Records - 

"Slowly the crowd gathers, heads hung as the musicians pick up their instruments. Upon the first note of feedback the heads start moving. Both performer and witness begin a ritualized dance in a flurry of hair, a profane genuflection. An unholy bow. 

THE UNHOLY BOW is the final publication in artist TERENCE HANNUM's bi-monthly publication series for 2011 following his issues PURIFICATION, DARK MATTER/DUNKLE MATERIE (w/ Alexander Binder), DEATH POSTURE, ABLATION and NEGATIVE LITANIES. This issue focuses on the group ritual of the headbang ubiquitous in heavy metal culture, by cropping drawings and digital photo collages into a printed cadence and features a brief musing cadence from the artist."

Printed in an Edition of 125.

name: VARIOUS ARTISTS - Fo(u)r Burials CD
description: This is a reissue of the classic doom split that has been remastered and features new artwork by Chimere Noire. Fo(u)r Burials is a lost classic of extreme doom, and has now finally, reverently been brought back into circulation by The Flenser. Featuring monolithic emissions from Mournful Congregation, Loss, Orthodox, and Otesanek, this four-track album reeks of desolation, the gnashing of teeth and virulent decay. “Heavy” does not begin to do these songs justice; the riffs stumble and crawl through an acid bath of feedback and distortion, dragging themselves along on broken knees. Funereal horde Mournful Congregation hail from Australia, and recently released a much-hailed compilation album via 20 Buck Spin, as well as news of a brand-new full-length and virgin US tour. With “Despond” (Profound Lore), Nashville’s Loss released one of the most painfully beautiful and critically-acclaimed albums of 2010, entombing listeners with a richly melodic, flowing shroud of depression. Orthodox’s ultra-minimal, droning, ambient take on the traditional rites of doom bleeds forth from Spain and belies the myth that sun breeds contentment. Otesanek, now-defunct and much-missed, crawled out of the filth and desperation of Philadelphia; their sludgy, crusty, unbearably brutal sound remains unmatched today. The quartet of compositions on Fo(ur) Burials are all very different, yet drawn together by a shared atmosphere of longing, sadness, and disgust for that which we call life. The cult of death is calling. Dig in.
